channel.title: Articles on Beersonthewall
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on Beersonthewall

item.title: Resources for Learning OS Dev
item.description: Recently I’ve been learning os dev and there’s a surprising amount of freely available resources for getting started with little to no direct experience (with OS dev, you need to know how to program already). Below is a list of the resources I’ve found inredibly helpful. OS dev wiki Writing an OS in Rust (and the first edition) Redox OS Serenity OS Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces

item.title: Kernel Debug Log 1
item.description: Debug logs: What follows is more-or-less stream of conciousness notes written while I was debugging my kernel code. I’ve found that writing my thought process down makes it easier to logically work through a problem. Additionally it’s nice to document how I’ve solved problems. The problem statement: I’m currently trying to implement recursive page tables in my x86_64 kernel project. I’ve just gotten the map() function for the page mapper to stop faulting when mapping a test page, now we’re trying to make use of the newly mapped page:

item.title: Weird Rust Lifetime Error
item.description: While working on a side project I encounterd some surprising (to me) behavior when I tried to change a function from using a named return type to Self. Here’s a boiled-down example of the code I started with: struct A<'a> { value: &'a str, } impl A<'_> { fn new(src: &str) -> A { A { value: src, } } fn value(&self) -> &str { self.value } } fn main() { let value = "Hello, World!
